text: Ðis is seo gerædnys, þe Eadgar cyng mid his witena geðeahte gerædde, Gode to lofe & him sylfum to cynescipe & eallum his leodscipe to þearfe.
Þæt syndon þonne ærest, þæt Godes cyrican syn rihtes wyrðe.
& man agife ælce teoðunge to þam ealdan mynstre, þe seo hernes tohyrð; & þæt sy þonne swa gelæst, ægðer ge of þegnes inlande ge of geneatlande, swa swa his sulh gega.
Gyf hwa þonne ðegna sy, ðe on his boclande cyrican habbe, þe legerstow on sy, gesylle he þane þriddan dæl his agenre teoðunge into his cyrican.
Gyf hwa cyrican habbe, þe legerstow on ne sie, ðonne do he of þam nigan dælum his preoste þæt þæt he wille.
& ga ælc cyricsceat into þam ealdan mynstre be ælcum frigan eorðe.
& sie ælcre geoguðe teoðung gelæst be pentecosten & þara eorðwæstma be emnihte; & ælc cyricsceat sy gelæst be Martinus mæssan, be þam fullon wite, þe seo domboc tæcð.

& gyf hwa þonne ða teoðunge gelæstan nelle, swa we gecwedan habbað, fare þæs cynges gerefa to & þæs biscopes & þæs mynstres mæssepreost, & niman unþances þæne teoðan dæl to þam mynstre, þe hit togebyrige, & tæcan him to ðam nigeðan dæle.
& todæle man þa eahta dælas on twa, & fo se landhlaford to ealfan, to ealfan se biscop, sy hit cynges man, sy hit þegnes.
& sy ælc heorðpæning agyfen be Petres mæssedæg.

& se ðe þonne to ðam andagan gelæst næbbe, læde hine to Rome & þærtoeacan XXX pænega, & bringe þonne þanon swytolinga, þæt he þær swa micel betæht hæbbe; & þonne he ham cume, gylde þam cynge hundtwelftig scillinga.
& gyf he hine eft syllan nylle, læde hine eft to Rome & oðre swylce bote; & þonne he ham cume, gylde þam cynge twahund scillinga.
Æt þam þriddan cyrre gyf he þonne git nelle, þolie ealles þæs ðe he age.
& healde man ælces Sunnandæges freols fram nontide þæs Sæternesdæges oð ðæs Monandæges lihtinge, be þam wite, þe domboc tæcð, & ælcne oðerne mæssedæg, swa he bebodan beo.
& man beboden fæsten healde mid ælcre geornfulnesse.
